How to play Toonstruck in Windows XP


1. Install IsoBuster 2.2 if it is not already installed on your computer.

OFFICIAL SITE - http://www.isobuster.com
DOWNLOAD FILE - http://www.isobuster.com/dl.php?v=1&l=0


2. Open 'Toonstruck.English.CD1.iso' with IsoBuster, right-click the small red ISO box and click 'Extract -' and when asked for a location, just select the Desktop. This should extract all the files in the image to a folder on the Desktop (named '-').


3. Open 'Toonstruck.English.CD2.iso' and again, right-click the small red ISO box and click 'Extract -' and select the Desktop. A window will open to say 'File already exists'. Tick 'Yes to All' and click 'Yes. The files you overwrite are exactly the same on both images, so there is no need to worry. Once extracted, you will have the content of both CDs in one folder.


4. Rename the folder 'Toonstruck' and move it to 'C:' (where Program Files and Windows is located).


5. Install DOSBox 0.72 if it is not already installed on your computer.

OFFICIAL SITE - http://dosbox.sourceforge.net
DOWNLOAD FILE - http://prdownloads.sourceforge.net/dosbox/DOSBox0.72-win32-installer.exe?download


6. Go to: Start > All Programs > DOSBox-0.72 > 'DOSBox.conf'. The file should open in Notepad.

If it doesn't, go to: My Computer > C: > Program Files > DOSBox-0.72
Right-click 'dosbox.conf'.
Click 'Properties'.
Next to 'Opens with', click 'Change...'.
Select 'Notepad'.
Click 'OK' then 'OK'.
Go back to: Start > All Programs > DOSBox-0.72 > 'DOSBox.conf'.


7. Copy all of the following text (in-between the lines).


-------------------------
[sdl]
fullscreen=true
fulldouble=false
fullresolution=original
windowresolution=original
output=surface
autolock=true
sensitivity=100
waitonerror=true
priority=higher,normal
mapperfile=mapper.txt
usescancodes=true

[dosbox]
language=
machine=vga
captures=capture
memsize=32

[render]
frameskip=0
aspect=false
scaler=normal2x

[cpu] 
core=auto
cycles=max
cycleup=500
cycledown=20

[mixer]
nosound=false
rate=44100
blocksize=2048
prebuffer=10

[midi]
mpu401=intelligent
device=default
config=

[sblaster]
sbtype=sb16
sbbase=220
irq=7
dma=1
hdma=5
mixer=true
oplmode=auto
oplrate=44100

[gus]
gus=true
gusrate=44100
gusbase=240
irq1=5
irq2=5
dma1=3
dma2=3
ultradir=C:\ULTRASND

[speaker]
pcspeaker=true
pcrate=22050
tandy=auto
tandyrate=22050
disney=true

[bios]
joysticktype=auto
timed=true
autofire=false
swap34=false
buttonwrap=true

[serial]
serial1=dummy
serial2=dummy
serial3=disabled
serial4=disabled

[dos]
xms=true
ems=true
umb=true
keyboardlayout=none

[ipx]
ipx=false

[autoexec]
MOUNT C C:\
MOUNT F C:\Toonstruck
F:
INSTALL.BAT
-------------------------


Go back to the 'DOSBox.conf' window and press 'Ctrl+A' to highlight all the text. Press 'Ctrl+V' to paste the new text over the original. Save the file, but don't close the window yet.


8. Run 'DOSBox 0.72'. It should load a DOS based installer entitled 'ToonStruck Installation Program'.


9. Press the 'Down' arrow twice to highlight 'Install ToonStruck' and press 'Enter' to install the game.


10. Next you'll want to configure the sound and video.


On 'Configure Sound', press 'Enter'.
On 'Start Sound Setup', press 'Enter'.
Select 'Manual' and press 'Enter', select 'Sound Blaster' and press 'Enter' 4 times.
On 'Test Settings', press 'Enter'.

Hopefully you will heard a clear spoken (creepy) voice: 'Welcome to Toonstruck...'.

If you don't then go back to 'Start Sound Setup', select 'Automatic' and test again.
If there is still no sound or it is distorted etc. use trial and error to find a combination that works.

Press the 'Down' arrow to 'Exit Sound Setup' and press 'Enter'.


On 'Configure Video', press 'Enter'.
On 'Start Video Setup', press 'Enter'.
Select 'OK' to everything, following the instructions as they come.
You should eventually see a clear, colour image. Press any key to continue.
On 'Exit Video Setup', press 'Enter' and on 'Exit Installation', press 'Enter'.


11. To play Toonst

How to play Toonstruck in Windows Vista


1. Install IsoBuster 2.2 if it is not already installed on your computer.

OFFICIAL SITE - http://www.isobuster.com
DOWNLOAD FILE - http://www.isobuster.com/dl.php?v=1&l=0


2. Open 'Toonstruck.English.CD1.iso' with IsoBuster, right-click the small red ISO box and click 'Extract -' and when asked for a location, just select the Desktop. This should extract all the files in the image to a folder on the Desktop (named '-').


3. Open 'Toonstruck.English.CD2.iso' and again, right-click the small red ISO box and click 'Extract -' and select the Desktop. A window will open to say 'File already exists'. Tick 'Yes to All' and click 'Yes. The files you overwrite are exactly the same on both images, so there is no need to worry. Once extracted, you will have the content of both CDs in one folder.


4. Rename the folder 'Toonstruck' and move it to 'C:' (where Program Files and Windows is located).

6. Go to: Start > All Programs > DOSBox-0.72, right-click 'DOSBox.conf' and click 'Run as administrator'. The file should open in Notepad.

If it doesn't, go to: Computer > C: > Program Files > DOSBox-0.72
Right-click 'dosbox.conf'.
Click 'Properties'.

Go back to: Start > All Programs > DOSBox-0.72, right-click 'DOSBox.conf' and click 'Run as administrator'.

Go back to the 'DOSBox.conf' window and press 'Ctrl+A' to highlight all the text. Press 'Ctrl+V' to paste the new text over the original. Save the file, but don't close the window yet.


8. Run 'DOSBox 0.72'. It should load a DOS based installer entitled 'ToonStruck Installation Program'.


9. Press the 'Down' arrow twice to highlight 'Install ToonStruck' and press 'Enter' to install the game.


10. Next you'll want to configure the sound and video.


On 'Configure Sound', press 'Enter'.
On 'Start Sound Setup', press 'Enter'.

To fix stuttering sound:

1. Go to the directory where you installed toonstruck and open toonstrk.cfg with notepad.

2. Replace everything under [DIGITAL] with this
DeviceName = Sound Blaster           
DeviceIRQ = 5
DeviceDMA = 1
DevicePort = 0x220
DeviceID = 0xe000
DeviceMonoID = 0xe000
Stereo = 0
TimerRate = 60
Flip = 0

If that doesnÂ´t work, try changing DeviceIRQ = 5 to DeviceIRQ = 7


If you have problems with disappearing graphics, run toonstrk.bat with the variable -b

i.e when I run toonstruck in dosbox it looks like this:

c:\toonstrk\toonstrk.bat -b

Thanks for the great up! While cycles=max in DOSBox is usually a good idea, there's a certain passage in the game where the execution speed greatly surpasses that given by the recommended Pentium 133 MHz running native.

Thanks. Works perfectly with the guide.

I can't believe I was able to play this one perfectly on Windows 7 x64. :D

However. Do note that you may need to decrease the speed of DosBox at certain points of the game to accomplish some tasks. Some scenes would be too fast to handle. Nothing to worry about though.

I read it somewhere that it also works on ScummVM. Anyone tried?

i've managed to fumble my way through this but get to the point of setting up the video an keep getting an error.. 'crashed while attempting to configure UniVBE'.. then another error saying its crashed trying to use something other than UniVBE.. any help please?

===Toonstruck on Vista/Win7===

The game seems to be perfectly emulated by ScummVM, so basically all you need to do is follow the first 4 steps of Vicar in a Tutu's (awsome) guide, then run ScummVM (you can get it here: http://www.scummvm.org/downloads/?p=downloads), click add game and then browse to your Toonstruck folder in your hard disk drive. This method saves you from lots of glitches, the installation process, sound problems and it guarantees the best optimizes emulation possible. 

So far I've played the intro and the first 4-5 screens of the Cutopia and everything seems to work marvelously. 

Enjoy.
